verses.text: 約櫃在非利士各城引起的災害非利士人搶去了 神的約櫃，就把它從以便以謝運到亞實突。

words.note: Refers to the sacred chest described in the Hebrew Bible.
A region and people mentioned in the Bible.
Refers to the people of Philistia.
The preceding space indicates reverence for God's name.
Refers to the sacred chest described in the Hebrew Bible.
A place name in the Old Testament.
One of the five principal cities of the Philistines.

verses.text: 非利士人搶去 神的約櫃，把它抬進大袞廟，放在大袞神像的旁邊。

words.note: Refers to the people of Philistia.
The preceding space indicates reverence for God's name.
Refers to the sacred chest described in the Hebrew Bible.
The temple dedicated to the Philistine god Dagon.
The national god of the Philistines.

verses.text: 第二天清早，亞實突人起來，看見大袞神像仆倒在地，俯伏在耶和華的約櫃面前。他們就把大袞神像豎立起來，放回原處。

words.note: Refers to the inhabitants of Ashdod.
The national god of the Philistines.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Refers to the sacred chest described in the Hebrew Bible.
The national god of the Philistines.
Used as a verb complement to indicate an upward or outward action.

verses.text: 再次日早晨，他們起來的時候，看見大袞神像又仆倒在地，俯伏在耶和華的約櫃面前，大袞的頭和雙手也都在門檻上折斷了，只剩下大袞的身體。

words.note: Connects verb phrase to '時候' (when).
The national god of the Philistines.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Refers to the sacred chest described in the Hebrew Bible.
The national god of the Philistines.

words.definition: both hands, a pair of hands

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here.
The national god of the Philistines.

verses.text: 因此大袞的祭司和所有進亞實突大袞廟的人，都不踏大袞廟的門檻，直到現在。

words.note: The national god of the Philistines.
One of the five principal cities of the Philistines.
The temple dedicated to the Philistine god Dagon.
The national god of the Philistines.

verses.text: 耶和華的手重重地壓在亞實突人身上，敗壞他們，用痔瘡擊打亞實突和亞實突四境的人。

words.note: God's personal name
Often translated as tumors or plague in this context.

verses.text: 亞實突人看見這種情形，就說：「以色列 神的約櫃不可再留在我們這裡，因為他的手重重地加在我們和我們的神大袞身上。」

words.note: Refers to the God of Israel, capitalized.
Refers to a pagan deity, lowercase.

verses.text: 他們就派人去召集非利士人各城的首領前來，問他們：「我們要怎樣處理以色列 神的約櫃呢？」他們回答：「把以色列 神的約櫃運到迦特去吧。」他們就把它運到迦特去了。
運到那裡以後，耶和華的手攻擊那城，引起很大的恐慌。他擊打全城的人，不分老幼，使痔瘡在他們中間蔓延。
於是他們把 神的約櫃送到以革倫。 神的約櫃到了以革倫的時候，以革倫人就喊叫：「他們把以色列 神的約櫃運到我們這裡來，是要殺害我們和我們的人啊！」
於是他們派人去召集非利士人各城的首領前來，對他們說：「請把以色列 神的約櫃送回原處，免得它殺害我們和我們的人民。」死亡的恐慌籠罩全城，因為 神的手重重地壓在那裡。

words.note: Ancient people who often warred with Israel.
Introduces the object of a verb, placing it before the verb.
The name of a nation and its people in the Bible.
A special space used in Chinese Bibles before '神' (God) to show reverence.
Proper noun for the one God in Abrahamic religions.
A sacred chest containing the tablets of the Ten Commandments.
A special space used in Chinese Bibles before '神' (God) to show reverence.
Proper noun for the one God in Abrahamic religions.
Reduplication emphasizes the degree.

verses.text: 沒有死的人都遭受痔瘡的打擊；那城的哀聲，上達於天。

words.note: Forms an adjectival phrase 'those who died not' or 'not-dying ones'.
A specific affliction described in the Bible, referring to tumors/boils.
Literary or formal preposition, similar to '到' or '在'.
